programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (3)
programme.desc: Savannah. The African savanna is an epic landscape, and whether it's head-bashing hippos, hormone-crazed elephants or dueling lions, battles that rage on the savanna are just as epic.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (4)
programme.desc: India. Welcome to India - a land of exotic animals and exotic warfare; monkeys stage dusty dust-ups, blackbucks wage open war on the open plains, and peacock dandies swing switchblades: these are colorful battles worthy of a vibrant land.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (5)
programme.desc: Coastal Waters. Massive elephant seals go nose to nose to win the title of beach master; giant petrels earn the nickname "murderous garbagemen"; a female humpback goes to extremes to protect her calf from amorous males.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (6)
programme.desc: Canada. Canada, where summer is short and time is tight, any time is the right time to fight; the mighty North provides the setting for bison, bald eagles and polar bears to wage some of the most heavy-duty fighting in the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (7)
programme.desc: South America. Learning to fight dirty with a guanaco, head-butting a fellow iguana to claim a piece of prime territory, and meeting a hermit crab who forcibly evicts a tenant from its shell.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (8)
programme.desc: Southeast Asia. With real-life dueling dragons, giant sumo-wrestling beetles, street-fighting monkeys, and sea turtles that play king of the hill - on top of another sea turtle, Southeast Asia boasts a wide range of wildlife warriors.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year (2)
programme.desc: Summer. Examining the extremes of summer in Africa; from droughts and famine to abundance and feasting, summer impacts the flora and fauna of the continent.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife X (10)
programme.desc: Spring. When a worldwide pandemic cripples the rehab, wildlife emergencies keep coming in: a bobcat that's been shot, and a massive adult seal; Hope's down to a skeleton crew as critical team members go into quarantine.

programme.desc: Delta Discoveries. Inside the Mackenzie Delta, a transition zone of the boreal forest to the frozen tundra.

programme.sub-title: Fall on the Tundra. The people of Nunavik prepare for the coming winter.
programme.desc: Fall on the Tundra. The people of Nunavik prepare for the coming winter.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild III (3)
programme.desc: Save the Giants. The coastline of Mozambique attracts some of the world's largest filter feeders; Two of Mozambique's leading marine researchers, Andrea Marshall and Nakia Cullain, set out to find one of the ocean's most secretive animals.

programme.title: Wild Wild East (1)
programme.desc: Rivers. An in-depth look at the American shad on its epic journey upstream, back to its fresh water birthplace to spawn.

programme.title: Wild Wild East (6)
programme.desc: Skies. The bald eagle reigns supreme as the ultimate predator above the waters of Bras d'Or Lake on Canada's eastern shore.

programme.desc: A New Hope. Hope releases the last of her deer herd as spring approaches but one fawn doesn't want to leave.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild (1)
programme.desc: Lyca the Painted Wolf. In central Namibia, a pack of painted wolves roams the arid land; amid threats from lions and drought, a plucky little pup called Lyca has to grow up fast, learn the skills of a hunter and find her place as member of the pack.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild (2)
programme.desc: Chinga the Lion Cub. In South Africa's Greater Kruger Park, a lion cub finds her place in the wild under the guidance of a devoted father, a fierce mother and a playful sister.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild (3)
programme.desc: Usana the Cheetah Cub. Cheetah cub Usana is born with the odds stacked against her, but she is lucky to have an amazing mother that will stop at nothing to keep her cubs safe.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild (4)
programme.desc: Chico the Baby Capuchin. Enter Brazil's Serra da Capivara at the beginning of the dry season as a troop of capuchin monkeys welcomes its newest member; explore the forest alongside the curious baby, who faces threats from predators, food shortages, and even the wild climate.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild (5)
programme.desc: Ravi the Baby Lion-Tailed Macaque. In India, Ravi the baby lion-tailed macaque faces life in a shrinking habitat and encroaching human world; Ravi has a caring mom, a protective dad, a playful sister and numerous, cousins, aunts and uncles all watching over him.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild II (1)
programme.desc: Test limits with jaguar cub Frida, who's honing her survival skills in Brazil's Caiman Lodge Reserve.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild II (2)
programme.desc: Lola the Sea Lion Pup. Sea lion Lola take her first chaotic steps into a macho battlefield on Argentina's coast; this baby learns key vocal and swimming skills, fights to stay by mom Maria's side, and makes a lightning-fast escape from the jaws of death.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild II (3)
programme.desc: Dora the Baby Murqui. Southern muriqui, Dora, takes her first steps away from her mom, Mimi; exploring spider monkey troop dynamics and tail-hanging technique.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild II (4)
programme.desc: Exploring Thiago, a brave baby coati and how he sharpens his sniffing and foraging skills, crosses suburban roads near his lush Brazilian forest home, and avoids inanimate and four-legged dangers.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild II (5)
programme.desc: Visiting the last stronghold of the giant river otter in Brazil's beautiful Pantanal wetland and track pup Rio and his siblings as they test the waters, team up to evade a jaguar ambush, and become a cohesive family unit.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (1)
programme.desc: Madagascar. Madagascar is home to strange animals not found anywhere else on Earth; when these animals fight for supremacy, their battles are just as strange, from weird neck-wrestling weevils to ring tailed lemur moms that go into battle with baby on board.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (2)
programme.desc: Australia. Australia is home to an eclectic array of creatures, and the ways to succeed as an alpha are just as diverse; the beach turns into a dueling ground and the outback becomes a boxing ring, as animals face off with their own kind.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (3)
programme.desc: Savannah. The African savanna is an epic landscape, and whether it's head-bashing hippos, hormone-crazed elephants or dueling lions, battles that rage on the savanna are just as epic.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (4)
programme.desc: India. Welcome to India - a land of exotic animals and exotic warfare; monkeys stage dusty dust-ups, blackbucks wage open war on the open plains, and peacock dandies swing switchblades: these are colorful battles worthy of a vibrant land.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (5)
programme.desc: Coastal Waters. Massive elephant seals go nose to nose to win the title of beach master; giant petrels earn the nickname "murderous garbagemen"; a female humpback goes to extremes to protect her calf from amorous males.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (6)
programme.desc: Canada. Canada, where summer is short and time is tight, any time is the right time to fight; the mighty North provides the setting for bison, bald eagles and polar bears to wage some of the most heavy-duty fighting in the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (7)
programme.desc: South America. Learning to fight dirty with a guanaco, head-butting a fellow iguana to claim a piece of prime territory, and meeting a hermit crab who forcibly evicts a tenant from its shell.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (8)
programme.desc: Southeast Asia. With real-life dueling dragons, giant sumo-wrestling beetles, street-fighting monkeys, and sea turtles that play king of the hill - on top of another sea turtle, Southeast Asia boasts a wide range of wildlife warriors.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (9)
programme.desc: USA. Bighorn rams rattle the mountaintops; Brown bears battle, desperate to fatten up for winter; Sharp-tailed grouse shake their tail-feathers; Wild stallions rumble with beauty and grace.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (10)
programme.desc: Europe. From the Highlands to the Alps, Europe's evocative landscapes are the backdrop for epic wildlife drama; normally stoic red deer go wild during the rut; wolf packs clash over territory, and foxes do the foxtrot but it's not as nice as it sounds.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (11)
programme.desc: South Africa. Wildebeest battle for herd hierarchy, meerkats live the thug life, floppy fish fight it out on land and locusts give up their vegetarian ways in a frenzy of cannibalism; it all happens on the wild and wide-open landscape of South Africa.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (12)
programme.desc: Sub Sahara. The latitudes south of the Sahara offer vastly different battlegrounds for a wide range of warriors; male giraffes swing their heads like wrecking balls, zebras boast the most powerful kick in the animal kingdom, and chimpanzee warfare is familiar.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (1)
programme.desc: Weatherproof. Steering clear of alphas, whose horns, claws and other protective gear keep them ready for battle, no matter what the weather dishes out; examining killer Highland cow horns, plucky mallard bills, razor-edged wolverine claws, and more.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (2)
programme.desc: Agile. A male brown hare throws punches at his beloved; admiring a sandhill crane dance battle; ibexes butt heads (literally) during mating season; why leopards are stealth masters.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (3)
programme.desc: Social. Meeting alphas who get by with a little help from their friends; the inescapable gang mentality of mating male dolphins; ant colonies' unique scents; female geladas always get the last word; wolves hunt family-style.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (4)
programme.desc: Scrappy. Celebrating small but mighty animal warriors armed with sheaves of scary weapons; admiring nutrias' stink bombs; honey badgers' needlelike choppers; black-tailed gulls' razor-sharp beaks; the killer talons on dive-bombing peregrine falcons.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (5)
programme.desc: Pointy Bits. Elands lock corkscrew horns; storks rattle sabre-shaped beaks; rhinos scare the competition with massive horns; striped marlins spear unsuspecting prey.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (6)
programme.desc: Scroungers/Scavengers. Tasmanian devils get into food fights with rivals; how dung beetles roll over the competition; wild boars' fierce mating strategies; hyenas' bone-crushing teeth demolish any meal.

programme.title: Wildlife ER II (3)
programme.desc: The Gutsy Koala. A range of dedicated professionals and volunteers look after unwell animals and carefully nurse them back to health at the RSPCA Wildlife Hospital in Brisbane, Australia.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (9)
programme.desc: Power. Sea lions throw their weight around to win a mate, Cape buffalo deliver knockout punches, Canada geese hit hard with their wings, and lionesses rule the Savanna with an iron paw.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (10)
programme.desc: Ugly. Warthogs' lumpy armor, giant African bullfrogs' jumping and biting skills, wild turkeys' sharp beaks and razorlike spurs, and Nile crocodiles' powerful jaws.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (11)
programme.desc: Loners. A glacial stroll alongside a Galápagos tortoise; dancing with venomous European adders; a battle between Lacerta lizards; leopard seals' stealth attacks.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (12)
programme.desc: Chatty/Communicative. Chatty capuchin monkeys; Eurasian river otters' chilling screams; fruit bats' loud complaints; orcas' human-scale speech systems.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife X (3)
programme.desc: Harp Seals. Hope's team struggles to help two rescued harp seals learn the natural behaviors they will need to survive in the wild.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (2)
programme.desc: Monkey Madness. Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years; the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical; a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.

programme.title: Baby Chimp Rescue (2)
programme.desc: Breaking Point. At Liberia's only home for rescued chimpanzees, there are more new arrivals; Jimmy and Jenny Desmond and their team now have 28 chimps to look after, including an 8-week-old baby called Gaia.

programme.title: Epic Yellowstone (2)
programme.desc: Return of the Predators. Wolves are reintroduced after a 70-year absence; a lone wolf seeks to join the ranks of the Wapiti Pack; the endangered grizzly population makes a comeback; many of the bears are descendents of a legendary matriarch who is raising two new cubs.

programme.title: Epic Yellowstone (3)
programme.desc: Life on the Wing. Yellowstone's winged creatures survey the extraordinary landscape; the American dipper breaks winter's silence; sandhill cranes perform their courtship dance; bluebirds deliver food to their broods; an osprey fends off a peregrine falcon's attack.

programme.desc: Harp Seals. Hope's team struggles to help two rescued harp seals learn the natural behaviors they will need to survive in the wild.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (2)
programme.desc: Monkey Madness. Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years; the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical; a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.

programme.title: Baby Chimp Rescue (2)
programme.desc: Breaking Point. At Liberia's only home for rescued chimpanzees, there are more new arrivals; Jimmy and Jenny Desmond and their team now have 28 chimps to look after, including an 8-week-old baby called Gaia.

programme.title: Wild Fighters (4)
programme.desc: The Struggle for Love. The love rivalry shakes every fiber of the body as hormones invade the blood, and some of the most overwhelming spectacles on the planet are produced; the language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most diverse behaviors.

programme.title: Policistky v akci II (10)

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: Otter Disaster. Everyone is too busy to play with Toad so he foolishly opens the lock gates in order to propel his new boat. But this creates a giant wave that demolishes the Otters’ holt downstream. Toad must now repair their home, finding help from an unexpected quarter.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Things We Love. The bugs talk about what they love.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Trying. The bugs talk about trying new things.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Momella Day. Ella always looks forward to Momella Day. And this Momella day promises to be the most interstellar yet, because they are going to see a small but powerful Red Dwarf star!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The Martian Chronicles. Priya has arrived from Earth to complete a school project about Mars. Priya is unfamiliar with the planet and a bit nervous about its huge dust storms. Ella, Slippy and Madhu convince her she needs to visit Mars.

programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time

Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

As the nebula messes with their racers and gadgets, escape becomes hopeless. It’s up to Ella and Madhu to find a way to guide them safely back home!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Space Junk. When Space Junk smashes into their clubhouse, Ella and Slippy set off to fix the problem. While Ella wants to be rid of the junk, Slippy’s determined to reuse or at least recycle it. When Ella is trapped, re-using space junk may be the only way to save her!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Meanie Genie. After the witches fly off into the night, Tom chases Jerry into a room full of enchanted bottles. When Jerry tries to hide in one, he inadvertently releases a mischievous thousand-year old genie who grants him three wishes.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: To Kill a Mockingbird. A mockingbird has taken roost in a tree outside Ginger's window, where it sings the sweetest songs whenever she's around. When she leaves for work, however, the mockingbird earns its name by mocking Tom and Jerry relentlessly. When her nest full of eggs hatches and the insults really take flight, Tom, Jerry and even Spike, decide it's time for these birds to fly the coop!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Bringing Down the House. While Rick and Ginger are away, an overly ambitious young housesitter ruins Tom's plans to rule the roost. Of course, Jerry delights in Tom's predicament…until the sitter spots the mouse, and he becomes enemy numero uno!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Hiccup and Away. When Tom gets the hiccups, the witches decide that the only way to cure him is to scare him, so they banish him to the Wicked Forest of Very Scary Things. Unfortunately, there really isn't anything that frightening in, so they enlist Jerry to conjure up some scares – a task that he's only too happy to oblige, by taking full advantage of the situation.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Big Little Problems. How can one little golf ball cause a crater the size of a house? By hurtling through space - that’s how! One little rock can cause a chain reaction by hitting bigger and bigger pieces.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Artful Bean. There’s easy money to be had in the art world and Mr. Bean is set on getting some of it. Once equipped with the right tools, he ventures into the countryside with a blank canvas in search of inspiration – and comes home with a painting full of life. Literally.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: The Fly. When Mr. Bean finds a fly in his room, it's war. He needs weapons. Fly spray? A rolled-up magazine? These are only the start. In desperation, he enlists a mouldy doughnut, an encyclopaedia, an upside-down dustbin and a club-hammer. Finally, Bean becomes the first man in history to wage war on a fly... with a fridge.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mime Games. A leisurely stroll in the park turns into a run when Mr. Bean is chased home by an angry Mime Artist. He is lost for more words than usual when the street performer makes himself at home and insists on being wined and dined. Bean ousts the pest from his house using the only language mime artists understand.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Spring Clean. It's the First Day of Spring and Mr. Bean sets about washing his clothes, his furniture, his teddy and himself. But, alas, there’s no hot water! A bit of inventive improvisation with an outside drainpipe proves Mr. Bean to be greener at D.I.Y. plumbing than he thought.

Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Heel! What a disaster!: the Queen’s favorite booties have gone missing! And if Alice and Lewis don’t find them, they’re going to have to shine all fifty-thirteen other pairs of shoes in her majesty’s possession! Hot on the heels of the mischievous boots, our two heroes must use clever tactics to persuade them to get back to the Queen’s feet!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Too Young. When Alice and Lewis go to the Valley of the Night to look for MooMoo wool, they run into Queen and Charlie. When the little prince asks if he can go with the girl and her rabbit friend, the Queen begrudgingly agrees, and orders the two friends to take good care of her nephew. Charlie is ecstatic to be able to go on a “big boy’s adventure!” But is brought down to Earth with a bang when he finds out his aunt has been following them on the quiet. Feeling betrayed, he decides to run away.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Frost Ball. The King of Frostaland invites the Queen to a “frost ball” in his realm. Eager to look good, the Wonderland monarch appoints Lewis to open the ball, and threatens to remove him as clockmaster should he mess up! The poor rabbit must now set about learning the art of “tea-skating,” a kind of ice-skating on teapots! Only problem is, he’s scared of taking the plunge and decides to listen to Dodson’s advice (the dodo’s taken on the role of self-appointed coach) instead of simply trying it out himself. Needless to say, Dodson exploits the situation to get extra special treatment. So Alice steps in, determined to do whatever it takes to bring Lewis to his senses.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Sleeping King. When the Queen reluctantly takes Charlie to Frostaland so he can take part in the traditional “Cherry-Choc Harvest,” she finds the King fast asleep, due to a blunder committed by Alice. But instead of helping Alice and Lewis find an antidote to break the magic spell he’s under, the monarch throws every monkey wrench she can possibly get her hands on into the works! Truth is: she’s jealous of Charlie’s affection for the King of Frostaland.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II
programme.desc: The Tallest Munchkin. Lion's regular rounds as King of the Forest are thrown out of whack when he meets Devin, a boy who says he's a giant Munchkin, who's been shunned by the other Munchkins. But when Dorothy and her friends convince him to embrace his uniqueness, Devin returns to Munchkinland and competes in the annual dance-a-thon to show he belongs among the Munchkins as much as anyone.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Lewis' Shadow. Lewis’ shadow becomes detached when Alice accidentally shuts the door behind her rabbit friend a little too fast! Alice finds it super funny. Lewis, on the other hand, is freaking out: his shadow’s a bit too facetious for his liking, not to mention the fact that Queen has a rule against shadows coming off! Unfortunately, the shadow has a mind of its own and the monarch soon finds out. When Alice and Lewis get grounded because of it, the rabbit blames his shadow. But when the latter comes to their rescue, he realizes he misjudged it. In fact, he actually grows pretty fond of it in the end!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Teatime on the Moon. Following a mess-up by Alice, the Queen shamelessly decides to hold her teatime ritual on the Moon, without asking its permission. During this “incursion,” Alice & Lewis do all they can to keep the satellite and its odd inhabitants (Moon-Cutie-Twees, who clean the moon all year round) from being disturbed. But unfortunately, the Queen gets it into her head to build a “vacation home” on the Moon! There’s only one way to get her out of there: her castle must be invaded!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: A Joker for a Queen. Jojo, one of the King of Frostaland’s joker cards, looks on in awe as Queen skillfully guides her procession of cards with a snap of her fingers! When the King responds with his own parade, however, he lets his cards do whatever they please, leaving poor Jojo clueless. This prompts her to decide to leave Frostaland and head off to train in Wonderland, to be part of the Queen’s parade. Noticing how sad the King is to see his joker card go, Alice and Lewis do everything they can to persuade Jojo to return. But in so doing, they too find themselves enrolled alongside the Queen’s cards!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Double Teatime in Wonderland. Jealous of the King of Frostaland, who is celebrating Alice’s “non-birthday,” the Queen organizes a double-teatime at the castle and forces all her subjects to attend. Alice and Lewis try to enjoy both celebrations. But there’s no denying it: it’s way more chill at the King’s party than the Queen’s, where the poor guests are subjected to fear and intimidation! In fact, it’s so bad that before long, the Queen’s guests start defecting, migrating to the more fun venue in Frostaland. Alice and Lewis try to avoid a crisis by making sure the Queen doesn’t find out they’re having fun behind her back…

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Dodson's Predictions. In order to escape punishment, Dodson kids the Queen into believing he is able to read the future. Falling for his story, Queen names him “Great Fortune-Telling Dodo” and invites him to live in the castle. Dodson milks it, using his influence over the monarch to fulfill all his desires, even if it means relieving poor Lewis of his clockmaster duties! Luckily, Alice runs to her rabbit friend’s rescue. But how are they going to prove to the Queen that Dodson doesn’t actually have a single power and that he’s merely using her for his own benefit?!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: In The Doghouse. Mike is forced to spend the day outside in his doghouse due to Grandma Mikkelsen's fur allergy. Mike makes the best of being exiled and plans to spruce the place up and invite Iris over for an outdoor picnic. But Mercury has been kicked out of his lair after a fight with his brother and decides to squat in the doghouse. Mike does everything he can to wake up the snoozing raccoon and get him out of his home. It looks like he's going to have to bring in the big guns if has any chance of evicting his unwanted guest before Iris shows up.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.sub-title: The Teacher Song. We love teachers! Take time to say thank you to your teachers today!
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.sub-title: The Soccer (Football) Song. Soccer (Football) is such a fun game! Sing and play along!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: The Photograph. Mr Bean is not allowed to fly off on holiday as his passport has no photograph. After failing to get one from a photo booth he tries numerous other ways to get his photo taken including photobombing a tourist’s snap. None of these work but after Bean is arrested maybe the police can assist him. Say cheese!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Dancing Bean. Mr Bean wants to impress Irma by entering them both into a dance competition at the local park. But his tango is terrible and his rumba ridiculous so he enrols for lessons at a local dance school. After an unsuccessful class at the dance studio and a trip to the library to teach himself Mr Bean has lost track of time. He needs to make it up to a disgruntled Irma but will his homemade effort ‘win’ her over.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Bean Shopping. Mr Bean manages to get himself locked in a department store overnight while spending too long trying on clothes. Bean takes advantage of the situation having fun in the various departments. But when he discovers a robbery taking place the fun and games stop as the desperate burglar chases Bean from floor to floor and all around the store.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Toad & Friends

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Friends. The bugs talk about what it means to be someone's friend.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Palladium Quest. When a friendly game accidentally breaks Maggie, Ella and co set out to find a rare metal to help fix her. But it’s a metal so rare it’s only in asteroids! After a few unsuccessful attempts, they realize the knowledge Maggie gave them before she broke could help save the day!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Friendship Supernova. Slippy wants to watch an eclipse so badly that he makes special safety goggles for himself and his friends. But Ella has a different plan. When she insists on going to watch a binary star supernova, Slippy opts out and heads off on his own.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: Otter Disaster. Everyone is too busy to play with Toad so he foolishly opens the lock gates in order to propel his new boat. But this creates a giant wave that demolishes the Otters’ holt downstream. Toad must now repair their home, finding help from an unexpected quarter.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Maggie 2.0. When a botched update causes Maggie to reboot as “Magz”, a super fun party animal, Ella, Slippy and Madhu are excited! At least until “Magz” excessive ways put them all in danger! Now, our gang have to figure out how to get Maggie 1.0 back, pronto!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Interstellar Message. When a probe arrives from Madhu’s sibling, our gang sets off to find something amazingly special to send back! But despite their incredible adventure to obtain some super cool moon water - Madhu realizes the most special “thing” they have isn’t a thing at all...

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Flea Bitten. When Tom finds Butch taking a bath upstairs, he gives the alley cat the boot. Unfortunately, a ring around the tub isn't the only thing he's left behind. With the house now infested with fleas, Tom, Jerry and Spike declare war on the pesky little bloodsuckers.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Shadow Boxin'. Trouble ensues when Tom is separated from his own shadow. Having been trapped with Tom its entire life, the shadow refuses to go back to the life it once had. But when the shadow becomes a total nuisance to Tom and Jerry, they team up to shed some light on the problem!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The Art of War. Rick's taken up painting to help him relax. Although he's warned them to stay out of his studio, Tom and Jerry inadvertently destroy his first painting. In an effort to reproduce it before he returns home, Tom and Jerry end up in a competition to prove who's the better artist. May the best Renoir win!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: From Nuts to Soup. When the Witch Sisters are brewing up their latest concoction, they discover that their stash of walnuts has disappeared. Needless to say, Jerry is enjoying the "nuts" of his labor, while Tom is sent out to gather more nuts. When Tom steals the winter's supply of nuts from a feisty flying squirrel, things go from bad to worse. Not only does the squirrel take Jerry's stash, but the irate rodent launches an attack on Tom inside the house.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Toodle Boom! Tom's planned afternoon rendezvous with Toodles goes off the tracks when the mouse-obsessed Toodles catches a glimpse of Tuffy and Jerry. Despite Tom's best efforts to keep her focus on him, her accident-prone ways force him to choose between romance and self-preservation.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: For the Win. Ella’s mom is a hall of fame Enceladus 500 race champion, and Ella wants to be just like her! She plans to skate, scooter race and geyser jump her way to a championship trophy!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Highs and Lows. Ella and Slippy have been practicing their rock-climbing skills, so that they can tackle the recently formed, huge crater on Saturn’s moon, Enceladus. Ella, however, prefers relying on her space boots to get her to the top of the rock wall

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.sub-title: The Teacher Song. We love teachers! Take time to say thank you to your teachers today!
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: In the wild. Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Missing Teddy. Whilst browsing the supermarket for lovely grub, Mr. Bean’s life-long pal, Teddy, is kidnapped. Bean tracks down the nasty men responsible and finds that Teddy is not their only captive. Mr. Bean rescues a hundred teddy bears once their ears are put through an industrial sewing machine.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: No Parking. Mr Bean drives his favourite Teddy to the cinema to see his favourite movie - 'Titanic'. Now he simply has to park the car. But when you're Mr Bean, nothing's simple. His ingenious efforts to find a parking space are persistently foiled. And the clock is ticking....

programme.desc: James and the Dragon

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Day Star. It’s the Night of the Stars in Wonderland and Lewis invites Alice to see the show. Afterwards, our two friends make an unexpected encounter in the garden: they find a little star that’s eager to see daytime! Alice is only too happy to help it fulfill its dream. But when it starts gradually losing its star dust, they realize there’s a risk it might not be able to rise back into the sky to shine once again alongside its relatives. Alice and Lewis must prevent that danger from occurring, ASAP! And so off they head to the Valley of the Night!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Tooth the Rescue! When one of Lewis’ teeth falls out, no little tooth fairy comes to see him. Instead, the whole of Wonderland converges upon him! Basically, in this world, a loose tooth is an opportunity for making a wish, which makes it a very sought-after commodity among the Wonderlanders!! In the midst of all this squabbling, Alice must use cunning to help her good friend Lewis hold onto his precious tooth!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Journey to the Moon. While delivering a yummy stew to the Queen, Alice and Lewis notice the moon is crying and that its falling tears are flooding the castle! Afraid her royal residence is about to collapse any minute, Queen orders Alice and Lewis to find a solution to this problem on the double! And so off they go to the moon, where a whole plethora of surprises awaits them.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Seam Stress. Today, Queen has decided to commission a unique dress from her talented Seamstress Card: she wants it made out of wild thread – a very difficult one to tame! And should her Seamstress Card fail to pull it off, she will be relieved of her duties on the spot! Alice and Lewis jump to it, coming up with all kinds of bright ideas to help out the poor card. As a result, in the end, a whole cat walk of dresses awaits the Queen!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz II
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Freeze-All Cutie-Twee. Alice and Lewis find the twins frozen in place! It turns out to be the doing of a young Freeze-All Cutie-Twee who has become friends with Charlie. In fact, these two besties are having the time of their lives, traveling all over the place, freezing the whole Kingdom, unaware that the young Cutie-Twee has not yet mastered its powers! Alice and Lewis must find a way to persuade Charlie to take the Cutie-Twee back to its peers.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Not a Piece of Cake! When the Wonderland cuckoos realize their precious wild strawberry pies have all been picked, it’s mayhem! They go bonkers, screeching up a storm, almost deafening our poor friends. The Queen subsequently orders Alice and Lewis to put an end to this din! But the mission gets tricky when our two heroes find out who picked the pies!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Snow Queen. Alice and Lewis make a "snow-woman" in the Queen’s likeness. But, miffed at not bearing a very strong resemblance to the original, she heads off to meet her model. Our two heroes are scared: their mockery is about to be discovered! But surprise surprise!: the Queen is anything but offended! In fact, she takes the snow-woman under her wing, even going so far as to appoint her her deputy! Unfortunately for Alice and Lewis, this icy substitute becomes just as moody as the Queen: now they’re going to have to do all they can to remind her who she truly is!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Blue Door Mystery. Queen is seething: her QueenMobile has broken down on the other side of Wonderland and she hasn’t found any blue doors to get her back home. So she commissions Alice and Lewis to draw up a map of all the blue doors in the Kingdom. The mission turns out to be more complicated than expected when our heroes realize the doors in question are VERY FIDGETY!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Trainee Book-Wizards. Before heading off on a trip to find new seeds, the Book-Wizard entrusts his garden to his new apprentices, Alice and Lewis. But it’s a pretty stressful experience: besides having to tend to the garden, they also have to answer the Twins when they come to ask for advice, and entertain the Queen when she decides to turn up unannounced, for teatime! And when Charlie gets whisked away by a bird-book, it’s panic-stations for the two apprentices. In fact, things get so out of hand that they have to call the Book-Wizard to the rescue!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike Flu. Poor Mike is bedridden. He's been struck down by a nasty cold so Iris and the turtles are forced take care of his every need, including trying to repel the raccoons from the house. Fighting raccoons isn't their specialty and Iris and the turtles quickly end up locked in the garage. Mike is forced to intervene but he's so sick and weak that he's a pushover. How can he overcome the raccoons this time? Mike's problem could be the very solution he needs to defeat the tenacious raccoons.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Red Light, Green Light
programme.desc: Red Light, Green Light

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: In The Garden. Mr Bean’s attempt to cut the grass is thwarted by a pesky root which refuses to budge. When Mr Bean breaks his spade he heads to the local Garden Centre to find a replacement. But instead of simply buying one he enters a gardening competition to win one - judged by none other than the Queen herself! Its gardening gloves off when Mr Bean goes into battle with his rival green-fingered competitors.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: A Magic Day Out. Mr Bean and Irma are off for a day at the seaside. Irma is travelling light but Bean wants to take almost everything his owns in an enormous trunk. Arriving at the seaside Bean’s trunk gets accidentally swapped with a trunk belonging to a famous stage magician. As Bean entertains Irma pulling rabbits out of hats the angry magician arrives on the scene - and he’s not a happy bunny.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Ball Pool. Mr Bean loves playing in the neighbourhood soft play centre – bouncing on the trampolines whizzing down the slides and most of all immersing himself in the ball pool. But he doesn’t like sharing the place with all those annoying kids. So Bean decides to turn his flat into his own private play area where he can play in peace. Unfortunately Irma Mrs Wicket and The Bruisers all want to join in the fun with him.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Pizza Bean. Mr Bean orders a takeaway pizza but when it arrives he feels let down by the size of it. So he sets out to bake his own unique Teddy shaped pizzas. Under the name Pizza Bean his pizzas become extremely popular and very soon business in booming. As a result rival pizza producer Don Crustyoni sees his profits plummeting and decides to make Mr Bean an offer he can’t refuse.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Constellation Prize. Slippy’s attempts to impress his cousins with constellation drawings goes awry, causing them to get lost in a nebula! As the nebula messes with their racers and gadgets, escape becomes hopeless. It’s up to Ella and Madhu to find a way to guide them safely back home!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Space Junk. When Space Junk smashes into their clubhouse, Ella and Slippy set off to fix the problem. While Ella wants to be rid of the junk, Slippy’s determined to reuse or at least recycle it. When Ella is trapped, re-using space junk may be the only way to save her!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Commander Slippy. The gang is playing tag the Meteoroid when Glitch fails to follow Slippy's instruction. He soon realises it's because Glitch saw the comet he's been tracking for months! Slippy is excited - he gets to tag a comet!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Earthbound Priya. Ella and Slippy are perfecting their triple corkscrews when Priya, Ella’s best friend from Earth, surprises her with a visit. Priya performs a perfect triple corkscrew to everyone’s amazement. Ella is frustrated that she still can’t nail it

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings II
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Into the Woods. When an accident leaves Jerry wrapped head to toe in bandages and unable to take his scout troop camping, a guilt-ridden Tom decides to lead the kids into the woods himself. Stuck at home, Jerry can't help but imagine everything that could possibly go wrong.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Ball of Fire. The hot dog relish that Crooked Eddie brings to the detectives turns out to be an explosive device that Tom & Jerry must now return to the lab before it inadvertently blows up the entire city.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The Crystal Contingency. Ella and Tilly’s playtime results in the smashing of precious crystals that are part of Mom’s meticulous experiments. Determined to replace them, Ella battles a pulsar and then a super-hot planet before she realizes her sidelined little sister could be a big help!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Jupiter's Moons. Slippy’s excited to try out his new Rocket Boosters. He’s so excited that he overloads them and becomes stranded on a dangerous moon with Madhu. It’s up to Ella to jog Madhu’s memory so they can find the right moon and save Slippy!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Baby Blues. While Rick and Ginger are looking after their adorable niece for the weekend, Rick jokingly puts Spike in charge of keeping the kid safe while Ginger goes to the store. Taking his new job seriously, Spike swears that nothing will happen to the baby. Naturally, this is where Tom and Jerry arrive on the scene to wreak havoc and make Spike's babysitting job quite possibly be his last!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Build-A-Beast. When Hildie and Beatie believe they've had a few of their things stolen, they employ a little magic to create Bog, the Cottage Beast. In order to prove that Bog is overkill, however, Tom and Jerry must confess to borrowing the "stolen" goods to beat up on each other.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: No Fly Zone. After Tom finally drifts off to sleep, Jerry heads for the coveted wedge of cheese in the kitchen – only to have a pesky fly get between him and his meal. Even though Jerry offers to share the cheese, the winged cheese bandit sets out to do his very best to make sure that Jerry will never enjoy that cheese – including waking up Tom!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Charity Case. Feeling bad for giving Tom's precious blanket to "Badwill," Jerry's determined to get it back. But with all the bizarre, enchanted items that have been donated over the centuries, getting anything back from Badwill is not easily done.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Tuffy's Big Adventure. When Tuffy and Tyke head out on their own big adventure into the snowy mountains during a family vacation, Tom catches the blame from Spike and Jerry for letting them go. But when all three set out on a rescue mission for the little ones, it's Tom, Jerry and Spike who'll need rescuing.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: That's so Madhu. Madhu has special presents for Ella and Slippy, to celebrate the anniversary of the day they met. But when Ella and Slippy say they can’t hang out, Madhu is sent off with only Maggie for company

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ghost Story. Slippy has heard a rumour that the abandoned outpost the gang plans to visit is haunted so he brings his ghost detector goggles, just in case! Ella assures him that there are no such things as ghosts, but then odd things begin to happen.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis
programme.desc: Six-year-old Alice has a magical key that leads her to Wonderland. In this “other realm”, she’s met an endearing rabbit, Lewis, and the two have become fast friends – best friends to be exact! Alice loves going to Wonderland and teaming up with Lewis and her other friends, even if it means contending with the whimsical, hot-headed Queen. Each episode entails a visit to Wonderland, where Alice experiences a wacky adventure with Lewis, confronting the crazy, eccentric rules and conventions that reign supreme in this parallel Kingdom. Alice’s adventures always begin in the “real world” where she is faced with a particular situation. Her far-fetched experiences in Wonderland lead her to a positive outcome or gain insight which helps her to resolve this dilemma and thus, at the end of each episode, she returns happily to the real world.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Everything's Coming Up Poppies. It's the Poppin' Poppies Parade and while making a float for Queen Ozma, Dorothy and her friends run out of poppies. When Wilhelmina gives them some of hers, it turns out they're the Wicked Witch's enchanted sleeping poppies, and Wilhelmina is planning to steal Dorothy's Ruby Slippers when she falls asleep. Now, it's up to Tin Man and Scarecrow to get help from the Good Witch Glinda before Wilhelmina steals Dorothy's slippers and all of Oz is put to sleep forever.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: A Cut Above the Rest. Ozma is helping Dorothy get ready for the big Oz Royal Ball, where all the Royals of Oz will meet. Dorothy's worried about remembering all the proper protocol, but luckily Patchwork Girl makes a magic dress that will help her! But when Wilhelmina's monkey minions, Frank and Lyman, sabotage the dress, the animated gown wreaks havoc, starting skirmishes between the royals. How will Dorothy manage to fix the Ball and show she was born to be a princess?

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: A Sick Trick. The racoons watch Mike enviously as he makes himself comfortable in his living room. If only they could get a piece of that sweet action. Then Freddy has an idea. He crashes into the bay window and pretends to be injured, forcing the Mikkelsens to take him in. Mike sees through the ruse immediately, but if he's going to unmask the scheming raccoon he's going to have to defeat the imposter without getting himself in trouble for fighting the poor "injured" Freddy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Wheelers of Fortune. Bricks are disappearing from the Yellow Brick Road. When Dorothy and her friends follow the wheel prints back to the Wheelers hideout, they find that Rustle, the biggest and baddest Wheeler, has been stealing the bricks to cover up the fact that his back wheel is broken. Dorothy brings Rustle to Smith & Tinker to fix his wheel. Overwhelmed with gratitude, Rustle helps them speedily repair the Yellow Brick Road.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Sister Sister. Glinda the Good's twin sister, Melinda the Mean, plans to displace Glinda as the most loved witch in Oz. Melinda thinks that being good can't be hard. But when each of Melinda's "good" deeds shows her true colors, Dorothy and the gang figure out there is an imposter! Now, they not only have to find Glinda, but also prove to the Munchkins that she is the true Good Witch.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Hoverboard. Mike is impressed with Tom's hoverboard tricks and decides to try to master them to impress Iris. As soon as Tom steps out, Mike tries to get his hands on the board but the turtles have other ideas. In fact, everyone seems to want a turn on the hoverboard, including the raccoons. It's the perfect way for them to get their loot from the house to their den. Mike is going to have to step up if he wants to defeat the raccoons and get Tom's hoverboard back.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Hypnosis. Mike wakes up in the bathtub, huh? The house has been turned upside down and the other animals are being weird. They're acting like zombies and carrying food out of the house. Our pug discovers that the raccoons have hypnotised Fluffy, the turtles, and Iris, and are using them to transport the contents of the Mikkelsens fridge to their lair. Our hero will need to confront Iris to save her from the raccoon's dastardly scheme... and refill the Mikkelson's fridge!

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!
